haefeleuser wrote:

> I have written a class called XyzTestCase which extends TestCase.
> 
> This has various reasons, for example because I needed to overwrite
> runBare method.
> 
> Now I come to a limit and I don't know if it is possible.
> 
> I want to perform something before the tests start. After all tests
> of a class have finished I want to perform another thing. Overwriting
> tearDown does not work for this requirement, it occurs too often.
> When the last test has finished I want to perform something. But it
> needs to be within JUnit, not outside of it.
> 
> So I tried to put this inte XyzTestCase. Its easy to perform
> something before every test started. I simply put it into a static
> constructor. But how can I perform something after every test has
> finished? I tried to overwrite various methods of the upper class
> TestCase, but it didn't help. They were called too frequently or not
> at all.
> 
> Can you please help me?

Look for junit.extensions.TestSetup. I think it's your solution.

One thing: I have never needed to override runBare(). Can you explain 
why you need to do it?
